Description:
This is a queer-friendly general-purpose federated Mastodon instance. If you are working or thinking in the fields of architecture, civil engineering, or urban studies, please be welcome to create a profile and start tooting!

Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Rules

  1. No racism, sexism / misogyny, ableism, anti-semitism / religious-based hate, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, or casteism.
  2. No incitement of violence or promotion of violent, white supremecist, incel, Holocaust denial or Nazi ideologies.
  3. No harassment, dogpiling, or doxing of other users.
  4. Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked as sensitive. Pornographic material may not be posted.
  5. No intentionally false or misleading information (this includes COVID-19 and vaccine misinformation).
  6. No spam.

Encouraged uses

  1. Brag about your publications.
  2. Share references and resources.
  3. Network with other academics.
  4. Put it on the last slide of your conference presentation.
  5. Recruit participants for academic surveys - formal, or even informal ones.
  6. Non-academic, "off-topic" stuff is allowed, but try to post this as Unlisted, not as Public.

Text and datamining

We are researchers and engineers, and you are very likely a researcher or engineer, too. And we want to support other researchers by allowing text and datamining in our instance. If you do not agree, please set the settings of your profile accordingly.

Research being conducted on this instance should follow ethical guidelines, should be approved by an ethics board if person related information is being dealt with, and should of course be published in compliance with open science principles.
Short: If you are working or thinking in the fields of architecture, civil engineering, or urban studies, please be welcome to lurk and toot with us on this queer-friendly, federated Mastodon instance!

Description:
This server was originally intended as a place for Catholic layfolk who had formed real relationships on other social media to have a home on Mastodon, however we are open to any and all Catholic, Catholic-adjacent, Catholic-interested, or none-of-the-above members.

Sister server to @religious.social which specifically hosts clergy, religious, and seminarians.

This server and all on-site infrastructure are operating on 100% solar power.

If you are interested in helping support this instance financially and are able to do so, please see our patreon page.
Short:
Adeste fidelis[sic], venite adoremus!

Description:
15-15-15.social es la comunidad virtual Mastodon de acceso restringido para personas suscriptoras, colaboradoras, simbióticas y amigas de la Revista 15/15\15. Versión beta.1.

Las cuentas pueden adquirirse en la tienda online de la Asociación Touda, editora de la revista, o en el web de la revista y necesitan, además, un código de invitación.

Contacto

  • Equipo de gestión: @revista.
  • Equipo de moderación: @revista, @moderatio.

Ayuda

Si eres nueva/a en Mastodon el equipo de gestión y moderación de 15-15-15.social estará encantado de guiarte en tus primeros pasos por aquí y resolver tus dudas. No dudes en preguntarnos, públicamente o por privado.

Introducción al código de conducta

El Código de Conducta de esta comunidad está formado por Recomendaciones (de cumplimiento recomendado pero no obligatorio) y Normas o Reglas del servidor (de cumplimiento obligatorio).

Aunque en la sección inferior de Reglas del servidor encontrarás una guía rápida de las Normas básicas y más importantes, nos gustaría aquí aportar un poco más de información acerca del funcionamiento y filosofía de esta comunidad.

Aunque creemos en la libertad de expresión, también creemos que el gobierno de los bienes y espacios comunes necesita basarse en unas mínimas reglas claras, justas y autocorregibles. Inicialmente hemos creado una serie de Normas y de Recomendaciones, que iremos adaptando y perfeccionando a medida que nuestra comunidad evolucione. Es importante que tengas en cuenta que la participación en la comunidad está supeditada a cumplir estas Normas, y que su incumplimiento puede significar medidas de moderación, incluyendo la expulsión (cancelación de la cuenta de las personas infractoras).

Estamos abiertos a las sugerencias de toda la comunidad para ir perfeccionando tanto las Normas y Recomendaciones como su aplicación, y os animamos a escribirnos para ello a las cuentas que tenéis indicadas más arriba.

Recomendaciones de conducta (v. beta.20220105)

  • Como usuarios de esta instancia, debéis tener en cuenta que nuestro nombre de usuaria/o termina en @15-15-15.social y por tanto nuestros actos en el Fediverso representan en cierta forma a esta instancia y afectan a la imagen y buen nombre de la Revista 15/15\15, tanto dentro como fuera de esta pequeña aldea digital. De hecho, el mal comportamiento de un miembro de esa comunidad al interactuar con otras, o simplemente sus publicaciones que sean trasmitidas a otras confederadas con 15-15-15.social podría ocasionar que la instancia en su conjunto fuese considerada non grata por otras y sus contenidos dejaran de trasmitirse en parte del Fediverso. Se recomienda encarecidamente, por tanto, el cuidado mutuo del conjunto de la comunidad y de la revista 15/15\15 con un comportamiento responsable.
  • Debido a esto, y en caso de que se reciban quejas de otras instancias, podrían irse añadiendo nuevas normas o convirtiendo recomendaciones opcionales en reglas obligatorias.
  • La mayoría de nosotras somos nuevas en el Fediverso, así que rogamos paciencia y también la ofreceremos. Aquí estamos para aprender juntas otro modo más sano de relacionarnos online.
  • No obstante, si te sientes maltratado/a por algún otro usuario, sufres microagresiones o cualquier otro tipo de comportamiento no recogido en las Normas, te animamos a que acudas a alguna de las personas del Equipo de Moderación.
  • Dado que nuestro equipo de moderación no conoce todos los idiomas del mundo, se ruega no publicar en idiomas que no conozca dicho equipo, que por el momento son: castellano, portugués, inglés, catalán, gallego, euskera, asturiano, occitano y esperanto.
  • En aras de una mayor accesibilidad recomendamos que se incluya una descripción textual con cada imagen enviada y que se haga un uso moderado de emojis o símbolos Unicode, lo cual facilitará el uso por parte de personas que utilizan lectores de pantalla.
  • Recomendamos que cada usuaria o usuario se automodere ya que no podemos ni tenemos interés en leer absolutamente todas y cada una de las publicaciones que se hagan en la instancia. No obstante, recordamos a todo el mundo que cualquier persona que nos lee, dentro o fuera de 15-15-15.social puede reportar cualquiera de nuestros contenido al equipo de moderación, es decir, que la propia comunidad vela por el buen comportamiento del conjunto.
  • Animamos a los usuarios a hacer uso de las opciones de bloqueo y silenciado (mute) para mejor controlar el contenido que aparece en sus timelines. Aunque la moderación se preocupa de bloquear a los peores abusones y de desconfederar a las instancias tóxicas, hay que reconocer que la gente posee diferentes límites y expectativas con respecto al Fediverso, así que con dichas opciones se facilita una experiencia más personalizada.

  • Recomendaciones acerca de los avisos de contenido (content warning, CW): Dado que no tenemos ni la capacidad ni el interés de monitorizar todo el contenido que se publique en 15-15-15.social, animamos que los usuarios a que sean ellos mismos los que avisen mediante la funcionalidad propia de Mastodon, el CW, herramienta que permite en cada publicación advertir de que otros usuarios podrían considerarlo molesto. Hay ciertos tipos de contenidos que recomendamos que siempre lleven este aviso, y si otros usuarios notifican al equipo moderador que se ha publicado sin dicho CW, podría ocasionar que se lo pusiesen los moderadores y que el autor o autora recibiese un aviso. Si esto se repite, podría ocasionar que se le silenciase o suspendiese su cuenta o incluso, si fuese un caso grave, que ocasionase su expulsión. Los contenidos que deberían contar siempre con un aviso de contenido (CW) son los siguientes:

    • Imágenes de cuerpos humanos desnudos y/o en actitudes sexuales.
    • Imágenes gore: sangre, heridas graves, tortura, asesinatos o intervenciones médicas.
    • Imágenes relativas al uso de drogas.
    • Textos detallando actos sexuales.
    • Textos que puedan inducir al suicidio, a autolesiones, abuso, violación o agresión sexual.
    • Textos que destripen argumentos de obras de ficción (spoilers).
    • Imágenes o textos escatológicos.
    • En general, cualquier imagen o texto ampliamente considerado repulsivo en las culturas actuales de los pueblos ibéricos.

  • Casos especiales de content warning:

    • Desnudez, sexo y drogas: Requerimos que estos temas incorporen avisos CW, entre otras cosas, porque su presencia como contenidos visibles en las timelines públicas pueden llevar a que otras instancias de Mastodon incluyan directa e irreversiblemente la nuestra en sus listas negras.
    • (Otros casos particulares serán incluidos aquí a medida que los vayamos detectando.)

Denuncia

  • Al contrario que las plataformas privadas y centralizadas, la moderación en el Fediverso se intenta que rinda cuentas y sea lo más trasparente posible dentro de lo práctico. Por ello se listan arriba las personas que componen en todo momento el Equipo de Moderación.
  • Contamos con que todas las personas participantes en esta comunidad nos avisen de toda forma de comportamiento o contenido inaceptable al que podamos responder de una manera razonable. El Equipo de Moderación hará todo lo posible para responder a estas denuncias en un plazo razonable.
  • Las denuncias que realizan usuarios de otras instancias del Fediverso acerca de los usuarios de 15-15-15.social son anónimas. Esto quiere decir que tan sólo sabremos de qué instancia procede la denuncia pero no el usuario concreto que la ha hecho. Por tanto, no podremos comunicarnos con esa persona para responder a su denuncia, y tan sólo podremos actuar tomando medidas dentro de nuestra instancia. No obstante, sí que sabremos quién denuncia desde 15-15-15.social.
  • Las denuncias que carezcan de una explicación son mucho más difíciles de procesar. Se agradece que incluyan enlaces, ejemplos, razones, explicaciones y cualquier otra información. En concreto es muy importante que se nos especifique cuál de las Reglas del servidor se ha vulnerado, por ejemplo. Debe entenderse que no podemos tomar medidas contra un usuario si no existe prueba de mal comportamiento.
  • Si la respuesta dada por el Equipo de Moderación no satisface a la persona denunciante, recomendamos que use las funciones de Bloquear o Silenciar contra la persona denunciada.

Desconfederación

  • Las personas gestoras de 15-15-15.social harán todo lo posible para mantener esta instancia desligada de las partes más tóxicas del Fediverso, intentando estar al día del iniciativas confederales como #fediblock.
  • Aun así, para mantener la utilidad de esta comunidad, nuestro criterio general será no desconfederarnos de grandes instancias a causa de las malas acciones de una minoría de sus usuarios, porque de lo contrario estaríamos privando a un gran número de usuarios de esas instancias de la posibilidad de conocer y dialogar con nuestra propia comunidad de usuarios. Por tanto, tenderemos más a bloquear y silenciar cuentas concretas, a no ser que la instancia en sí no tenga arreglo. Haremos lo posible por mantener líneas abiertas de comunicación con otras personas administradoras, pasarles denuncias acerca de sus usuarios cuando lo consideremos necesario o apropiado.

Revisión de recomendaciones y normas

  • Las personas a cargo de la instancia podrán decidir en cualquier momento la modificación de las normas y recomendaciones vigentes.
  • Sobre todo durante los primeros meses de funcionamiento, o a medida que el tráfico y el número de usuarios crezca, es previsible que las normas vayan variando con cierta frecuencia, perfeccionándose y detallándose progresivamente.
  • La entrada en vigor de cualquier cambio deberá ser notificado a los miembros de la comunidad, los cuales podrán optar entre aceptarlo o darse de baja de la misma si no lo aceptan, con derecho a recuperar la parte no disfrutada de su cuota anual, en su caso.
  • Los propios miembros podrán solicitar en cualquier momento la modificación de cualquiera de las normas. Para ello cursarán petición expresa a la persona gestora de la comunidad.

Desacuerdo con la moderación

  • Los moderadores podrán ser reprobados por realizar inadecuadamente su labor, si así lo solicitan los miembros de la comunidad a la persona a cargo de la Gestión de la instancia, que podría, previa consulta al Consejo Director del Instituto Resiliencia (CDIR), tomar la decisión de sustituir a la persona reprobada. La persona gestora será la encargada de recibir y gestionar las quejas y solicitudes de aclaración acerca de las normas y la moderación.
  • Cualquier divergencia en torno a la interpretación y aplicación de las normas de la comunidad, será remitida al CDIR, que será el órgano capacitado para tomar las decisiones al respecto, que serán inapelables.

Advertencias

  • Las publicaciones que incumplan las Normas o las Recomendaciones podrán ser denunciadas por cualquier miembro de la comunidad, lo cual podrá causar su retirada por parte de las personas moderadoras. Estas podrán, así mismo, enviar al usuario o usuaria autor de dicha publicación un aviso o advertencia. El hecho de que un mismo usuario reciba advertencias repetidas podrá llevar a que su cuenta sea suspendida o sea sometido a un proceso de expulsión.

Causas de expulsión

  • El usuario o usuaria que incumpla cualquiera de las Reglas del servidor listadas a continuación o sea reincidentes en un comportamiento que contravenga las recomendaciones verá el publicación en cuestión borrada y será sometidos a un procedimiento express de expulsión. Recibirá una comunicación en su cuenta y en su correo electrónico asociado, donde será informado/a de los motivos para que presente alegaciones ante el equipo moderador en menos de 24 horas. Si no se presentan o no son consideradas convincentes, el usuario o usuaria será borrado/a del sistema.
  • La administración de la comunidad facilitará a las personas expulsadas su migración a otras instancias.

Reglas del servidor (v. 20230113)

Description:
寒石百货 - Black | Hanshi - Black

寒石百货 - Black是一个Mastodon社交媒体平台，通过ActivityPub协议，你可以通过本站访问整个联邦宇宙的各个站点的内容，并和他们产生联系。

Hanshi - Black is a Mastodon social media platform that, through the ActivityPub protocol, allows you to access content from various sites across the fediverse and connect with them.

为什么存在 | Why We Exists

随着传统社交网络讲话越来越繁琐，我认为应该有一个地方让大家畅所欲言。 于是寒石百货便有了。

As conversations on traditional social networks become increasingly cumbersome, I believe there should be a place where everyone can speak freely. Thus, Hanshi was created.

中立性原则 | Neutrality Principle

寒石百货既不支持也不反对本站点中的任何观点。寒石百货只是一个中立的规则维护者。

Hanshi neither supports nor opposes any views expressed on this site. Hanshi is merely a neutral enforcer of rules.

如何运营 | Operation

寒石百货为非盈利项目，你可以联系@zen@social.kryta.app进行捐赠。

Hanshi is a non-profit project. You can contact @zen@social.kryta.app to make a donation.

隐私 | Privacy

寒石百货采用分布式架构，服务器分布于阿姆斯特丹、日本和纽约。所有用户内容均存储于基于Mastodon的数据库中，同时，为了保护您的隐私，我们删除了您的访问IP地址信息，仅保留负载均衡器的地址记录。考虑到隐私保护，建议用户使用一次性邮箱进行注册。

Hanshi is distributed across servers located in Amsterdam, Japan, and New York. User content is stored in a Mastodon database, with the additional step of removing your access IP address for privacy. Considering privacy protection, we recommend that users register using a disposable email address.

稳定性 | Service Stability

寒石百货长期运营。若因特殊情况需暂时关闭，我们将至少提前90天通过DM、电子邮件以及网站内公告通知所有用户。用户可在关闭前自行导出全部个人数据，并有选项迁移到其它网站。

Hanshi operates on a long-term basis. Should a closure be required due to special circumstances, we will notify all users at least 90 days in advance via Direct Message (DM), Email, and an announcement on the website. Users will have the ability to export all their personal data and have the option to migrate to another site before the closure.

令人不适的内容 | Disturbing Content

如果您发现任何令人不适的内容，请勿犹豫，使用我们的举报功能。寒石百货运营团队将会采取相应的处理措施。请注意，我们仅处理违反本网站规定的内容，并且处理过程需要充分的证据支持。如果您认为我们的规则有遗漏，需要新增规定，请通过联系@zen@social.kryta.app向我们反馈。对于其他情况，我们建议使用屏蔽功能。寒石百货致力于维护一个让人们自由发声的环境。

If you encounter any content that you find disturbing, do not hesitate to use report feature. Hanshi's operational team will take appropriate actions to address the issue. Please be aware that we only address content that violates the rules of the site, and the process requires adequate evidence for support. If you believe that our rules miss out on something that needs to be included, please provide your feedback by contacting @zen@social.kryta.app. For other situations, we encourage the use of the block feature. Hanshi is dedicated to maintaining an environment where people are free to express themselves.

账户安全 | Account Security

寒石百货强烈建议您设置两步验证来保护您的账户不被侵入。

Hanshi strongly recommends that you enable two-factor authentication to protect your account from unauthorized access.
Short: 我们欢迎任何语言，并且致力于提供人类最原始的快乐——围着一堆篝火聊天。Everyone is welcome.

Description:
Nach Twitter Space kam AfterSpace auf Discord. Der nächste logische Schritt war es jetzt, es auch auf Mastodon zu bringen.

Der Server wird von Focco und Max betreut.

Description:
Welcome to any.dev

Our instance motto is simple:

Let’s leave the internet a little better than we found it. And don’t be a jerk.

Specifically, we don’t allow:

  • Any form of hate or the advocacy of hate, including but not limited to racism, sexism, misogyny, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, nationalism, classism, ableism, and antisemitism.
  • Mean-spirited personal attacks, intentional unkindness, or doxxing. That doesn’t mean you have to be polite: in fact, members are encouraged to call out bad behavior. But again, don’t be a jerk.
  • Intentional misinformation.
  • Pornographic images/videos/etc. (This is for practical reasons: we’re not set up to handle the age verification and moderation burden associated with this kind of content).
  • Shilling crypto, gambling, scams, MLMs, etc.
  • Passing off someone else’s work as your own or non-comedic impersonation.
  • Content that has little-to-no value and is designed purely for engagement (see the reddit self-promotion guidelines for a sense of where to draw this line).

Moderation decisions will be made based on the spirit of these rules, not the letter. Extreme, blatant violations may result in an immediate ban. Most violations will be handled privately, and members will have the option to either remove/modify their post or migrate to another instance. If you are acting in good faith, we’ll do our best to help you migrate seamlessly to another instance that better matches your values without any disruption to your access to the fediverse.
Short: Let’s leave the internet a little better than we found it. And don’t be a jerk.

Description:
轻大站

轻大站禁止的内容

  • 政治相关的敏感话题绝不允许发布到公共时间轴（其他的高校网络），被举报后会被删除，发布者会受到禁言、封号处罚。
  • 违反中华人民共和国相关法律法规的行为和内容。
  • 严重影响其他同学使用体验的不友善内容，包括但不限于对他人的骚扰、攻击、诽谤等。

注册/登录方式

  • 仅支持轻大同学使用轻大云邮箱注册。
  • 可用电脑端网页登录，亦或是使用第三方APP登录。
  • 注册方式：
    1. 打开校内V*N扫码登录
    2. 在V*N界面点击智慧校园门户进入，扫码登录
    3. 点击应用中心，进入页面后打开云邮箱申请进行注册
    4. 用注册好的云邮箱注册

写在最后

在闭社，我们不会人为地引导话题方向。您可以讨论校内热点，也可以找人约打球约看展，也可以是寻找往年考题，失物招领。

只要不触犯一些众所周知的底线和影响其他用户，您在闭社上是相当自由的。

enjoy~
Short:
本站是轻大学子用于交流，一人一号的封闭社区。
秉持“轻大人不骗轻大人”的原则运行，站内均为轻大同学。
本站仅支持轻大云邮箱注册。
跨站板块已接入清华站、交大站、麻省站、福大站、闽科站、东大站、南理站、南理站、海事站、北工大站、西工大站。

Description:
Fonctionnement de l’instance

This server is mainly French speaking but English speakers are welcome.

Cette instance francophone est hébergée par IndieHosters et gérée/modérée par des membres du collectif Point Communs.

Pour soutenir l'instance financièrement, vous pouvez faire un don.

Les inscriptions sont ouvertes par défaut à condition de nous indiquer les raisons de votre inscription dans le formulaire. Elles fonctionnent également par cooptation (pour rejoindre l’instance, vous pouvez être invité⋅e par une personne déjà inscrite).

Cette instance a vocation à fournir un espace d’échanges aux commoners et plus largement aux acteurices de l'ESS. Vous pouvez donc vous y inscrire (sur invitation) si :

  • vous êtes un⋅e acteurice du réseau des communs / de l'ESS ;
  • vous prenez soin d’un ou plusieurs communs ;
  • votre sujet d’étude porte sur les communs / l'ESS.

Les inscriptions seront limitées à 100 comptes pour démarrer.

Lettre et esprit de la loi

L’état d’esprit des règles de l’instance est le suivant :

  • Les gestionnaires de l’instance ont la responsabilité de respecter la loi, et donc de modérer les contenus illégaux.
  • Au-delà de cette obligation, les responsables de l’instance n’ont pas vocation à dicter des règles sociales particulières à respecter.
  • Les règles de l’instance pourront néanmoins évoluer dans le temps en concertation avec ses utilisateurices car nous considérons l’instance comme un commun.
  • Les modérateurices sont des membres de l’instance comme les autres. Iels contribuent à faire en sorte que l’instance soit agréable à utiliser, avec l’aide de toute la communauté.
  • Les modérateurices étant des bénévoles et non des professionnel⋅les, iels n’ont pas le temps pour des échanges déraisonnables. Iels s’arrogent donc le droit de supprimer tout contenu sans préavis ni explication dans les cas qui leur paraîtraient ostensiblement de mauvaise foi ou clairement illégaux.
  • Vous avez la possibilité de signaler les utilisateurices qui ne respectent pas les règles de l’instance. Sur chaque profil, vous trouverez 3 petits points sous lesquels vous pouvez accéder au lien “Signaler NomDuCompte”. Cela aide l’équipe de modération si vous le faites et si vous précisez bien la raison du signalement.

Les règles de l’instance

Pour que les échanges sur cette instance soient agréables pour tous et toutes et restent dans le cadre légal, voici quelques règles. La majorité d’entre elles sont liées à la loi européenne (le serveur étant hébergé en Allemagne et géré depuis la France).

Tout⋅e utilisateurice ne respectant pas ces règles peut être “silencé⋅e” ou banni⋅e.

  1. Aucune discrimination ni dénigrement ne sera toléré concernant les informations qui pourraient être divulguées par les utilisateurices telles que : appartenance ou non à une prétendue race, appartenance ou non à une nation, sexe, identité de genre, orientation sexuelle, grossesse, handicap, origine, religion, opinions politiques, opinions philosophiques, situation familiale, caractéristiques génétiques, mœurs, lieu de résidence, ethnicité ou non, perte d’autonomie, capacité à parler une langue étrangère, vulnérabilité due à la situation économique, apparence physique, âge, état de santé. Cela signifie que les messages racistes, sexistes, homophobes, transphobes, validistes etc. sont interdits.
  2. Tout comportement de harcèlement moral, d’atteinte à la vie privée, de diffamation, d’injures, de menaces seront systématiquement sanctionnés par un bannissement.
  3. Les médias sociaux sont considérés comme des espaces publics. Par conséquent, la liberté d’expression, le droit à l’image et le droit d’auteur s’appliquent. Vous devez donc être conscient que le contenu que vous avez publié relève de votre responsabilité. Néanmoins, l’hébergeur peut être tenu pour responsable si des contenus illicites ont été diffusés, qu’il en avait connaissance, mais qu’il n’a rien fait pour les retirer dans les 24 heures. C’est pourquoi tout contenu illicite sera immédiatement retiré. Cela inclut notamment la pornographie enfantine (y compris dessinée), l’incitation à la haine, l’apologie des crimes de guerre, des crimes contre l’humanité, des crimes de réduction en esclavage, la négation de l’existence des crimes contre l’humanité, l’apologie publique des actes de terrorisme.
  4. Le contenu pornographique n’est pas autorisé sur cette instance, car nous n’avons pas la capacité d’en assurer la provenance légale et éthique.
  5. Les comptes parodiques sont acceptés mais doivent mentionner explicitement qu’ils sont parodiques dans leur description.
  6. Les bots sont autorisés. Cependant, les bots qui s’immiscent dans les timelines publiques peuvent être réduits au silence s’ils abusent (flood, spam, etc.). Les robots qui mentionnent trop souvent des utilisateurices sans leur consentement peuvent être suspendus.

Ce qui suit ne sont pas des règles à proprement parler, mais des conseils pour une utilisation apaisée de cette instance :

  • Il n’y a pas de contrainte particulière concernant l’usage du Content Warning (CW) mais vous êtes invité⋅es à les utiliser pour les messages/images explicitement sexuels ou violents.
  • Gardez à l’esprit que sur d’autres instances il existe d’autres pratiques. Il relève de votre choix personnel de les suivre (ou pas).
  • Il est apprécié que les images soient accompagnées de descriptions permettant aux personnes ayant un handicap visuel de comprendre leur contenu.
  • Il peut être pratique pour les autres que vous utilisiez des hashtags faciles à filtrer pour certains sujets d’actualité (politique, covid, etc.)
  • Si vous faites un thread, vous pouvez commencer par un message listé, suivi par des messages non-listés en réponse. Cela évite que la timeline locale soit accaparée par une seule personne.
  • Si vous êtes une personne particulièrement sensible ou phobique, nous vous conseillons d’éviter de consulter les timelines publiques de cette instance afin de ne pas risquer d’être confrontée à des contenus non sollicités.
  • N’oubliez pas que si vous n’aimez pas les contenus d’une autre personne, vous pouvez masquer temporairement ou définitivement un compte, ou le bloquer, ou même bloquer une instance entière. Vous pouvez également mettre en place des filtres pour masquer les contenus qui vous dérangent, voire même changer d’instance.
Short: Instance Mastodon francophone des communs et des commoners

Description:
We set up this server to accomodate ppl who can't stand other "social" media sites, either because the sites try to have too many functions, or because of abusive behavior by other users. We have rather strict rules to protect the neuro-diverse and gender-diverse communities. Abusive behavior is not tolerated, and we will not hesitate to close an account that has broken our rules. All languages are welcome.

Here are some guides about using this site

Caleida Admin
Short: ND friendly server. Fast and furious banning of abusive accounts.

Description: This Mastodon server is the official server for the sub-Reddit r/selfhosted. We welcome all users who adhere to our rules and specifically those who are into self-hosting. You can also chat with fellow self-hosters on Discord and Matrix.

Description:
Welcome to the UnFUG Mastodon Instance!

This instance is intended primarily for members, alumni, and attachments of the UnFUG. Other people can be approved on a case-by-case decision, but will be the exception.

We are currently not in need of additional funding.

Our website can be found at: https://unfug.hs-furtwangen.de

Description:
USTEDES SON PARTE DE LA RESISTENCIA!

Camaradas! Les damos la bienvenida al servidor de Mastodon de la Resistencia! Para registrarse, alguno de los admins (bicho o dashnak) tienen que aprobar la solicitud. Si no les están cayendo los correos del server, asómense a su carpeta de spam.

Este será un espacio para cotorrear, ñoñear, compartirnos contenido chingón como en el canal de Telegram de la Resistencia, resolver dudas, y básicamente ser compis.

El server fue provisto de manera por demás generosa y resistenciosa por el camarada Rosquillas, así que ahí cuando quieran le pueden dar las gracias.

Les recomendamos ampliamente leerse las reglas de esta instancia, y si tienen dudas respecto a qué pedo con Mastodon, se pueden asomar por acá: https://mastodon.help/es
Short: Camaradas! Bienvenidos al servidor de mastodon de la resistencia! Aquí podemos ñoñear de todo lo que platicamos en nonocast.com

Description:
Kintsugi Lab es una instancia de Mastodon para aquelles que quieren un internet feminista, anticolonialista y soberano. Un punto de encuentro seguro y creativo entre techies y usuaries.

/

Kintsugi Lab is a Mastodon instance for those who want a feminist, anti-colonial, and sovereign internet. A safe and creative meeting point for techies and users.
Short: Kintsugi Lab is a Mastodon instance for those who want a feminist, anti-colonial, and sovereign internet. A safe and creative meeting point for techies and users.

Description:
Univention GmbH

Wir entwickeln Open Source Software für das Management digitaler Identitäten und die Integration von IT-Anwendungen. Offenheit, Skalierbarkeit und der einfache Einsatz von IT sind dabei genauso zentral wie Digitale Souveränität und die Kontrolle über die eigenen Daten und Prozesse.

Univention Corporate Server (UCS) ist unsere Integrationsplattform mit Identitätsmanagement, umfassenden Active Directory Funktionen, einem App Center für die Einbindung von Enterprise-Applikationen und einem Nutzerportal für den Zugriff auf IT-Dienste. Schulträger und Bundesländer können über UCS@school – optimiert für den Einsatz im Bildungssektor – zentral und datenschutzkonform Benutzer-Identitäten verwalten, die Authentifizierung an Diensten ermöglichen und Lösungen für digitales Lernen über eigene Schulportale bereitstellen. UCS und UCS@school werden von zahlreichen Bundesländern, großen Kommunen und Landkreisen genauso wie von Unternehmen jeder Größe eingesetzt.
Short: Diese Mastodon-Instanz wird von der Univention GmbH betrieben.

Short: This server is dedicated to, and run by, fans. It celebrates headcanons and fixations and fanmade community, be that art, stories, gifs, playlists, or just plain old pterodactyl screams.
rules: [{'id': '1', 'text': "Be respectful to each other. Everyone is entitled to their own opinions, but please remember that we are showing appreciation to fan works here. You don't have to be a fan of everyone, but you also don't have to spread negativity. Such behavior is uncalled for, and may result in a ban."}, {'id': '2', 'text': 'This server aims to be as inclusive as possible. Fandom has many aspects to it, some of which can be controversial. Just because you may not agree with it does not mean that it should be outright banned. Mastodon offers filters for removing unwanted content.'}, {'id': '7', 'text': 'Use hashtags where appropriate. Hashtags will be required if the content falls into one of the following categories:  -- Graphic depictions of violence (#violence)  -- Rape/non-con (#non-con)  -- Underage (#underage)  -- Adult material (#nsfw) '}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'Also, tag any ships with the primary tag used in the fandom (I.E. #inukag for Inuyasha/Kagome from Inuyasha content). This will better help the content reach the desired audience and keep it away from those who do not want to see it.'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'NSFW content is allowed. However, it MUST be tagged (#nsfw) and be given a content warning. If the content is a photo, video, or some other form of visual content, all characters MUST be of legal age (18 or older).'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'Be kind and supportive of artists. Try your best to get approval from the artist before sharing their work and at the very least link to where you originally found it. '}]
cleaned_rules: ["Be respectful to each other. Everyone is entitled to their own opinions, but please remember that we are showing appreciation to fan works here. You don't have to be a fan of everyone, but you also don't have to spread negativity. Such behavior is uncalled for, and may result in a ban.", 'This server aims to be as inclusive as possible. Fandom has many aspects to it, some of which can be controversial. Just because you may not agree with it does not mean that it should be outright banned. Mastodon offers filters for removing unwanted content.', 'Use hashtags where appropriate. Hashtags will be required if the content falls into one of the following categories:  -- Graphic depictions of violence (#violence)  -- Rape/non-con (#non-con)  -- Underage (#underage)  -- Adult material (#nsfw) ', 'Also, tag any ships with the primary tag used in the fandom (I.E. #inukag for Inuyasha/Kagome from Inuyasha content). This will better help the content reach the desired audience and keep it away from those who do not want to see it.', 'NSFW content is allowed. However, it MUST be tagged (#nsfw) and be given a content warning. If the content is a photo, video, or some other form of visual content, all characters MUST be of legal age (18 or older).', 'Be kind and supportive of artists. Try your best to get approval from the artist before sharing their work and at the very least link to where you originally found it. ']

Description:
This Mastodon instance is a companion to the GAMES.NGO database of games intentionally created to drive positive change. (previously: mastodon.games.ngo)

Games for purposes beyond profit or entertainment and the communities that support, play, and research them. Most are intentionally designed to achieve prosocial means.

GAMES.NGO is a service offering by Jennifer Ann's Group, a nonprofit charity headquartered in Atlanta, USA.
Short: Games for purposes beyond profit or entertainment and the communities that support, play, and research them. Most are intentionally designed to achieve prosocial means.

Description:
Mastodon Instanz der Firma Avision GmbH in Oberhaching. Wir sind ein IT-Dienstleister mit starkem Fokus auf Open Source und Open Mind.

Die auf dieser Plattform geäußerten Ansichten und Meinungen sind die der Autoren und spiegeln nicht unbedingt die offiziellen Richtlinien oder Positionen der Avision GmbH wider.

Mastodon ist eine offene Plattform, auf der Meinungsaustausch und Redefreiheit Kernpunkte der Kommunikation sind.

Die Autoren und unser Unternehmen können nicht für Missbrauch, Wiederverwendung und falsche Zitate von Inhalten auf diesen Seiten durch andere verantwortlich gemacht werden. Es liegt in der Verantwortung des Lesers, die Fakten zu überprüfen.

Die Instanz wird von unserer IT betrieben und gehostet.

Die Anmeldung ist nur für Mitarbeiter der Firma möglich. Die Registrierung neuer User ist nicht erlaubt.

Description:
Intro

We are a community. Everyone in this space brings their own experiences and perspectives, and this intersection of personal histories can be messy. Though there is no way to create a truly universal 'safe space', we intentionally cultivate an atmosphere of mutual respect, understanding, and kindness here. We are all individuals doing our best, making our way through life together.

Code of Conduct

Posts or users will be removed if found to be in violation of the CoC, and repeated violations will result in an account limitation or suspension.

  1. No promoting NFTs, cryptocurrencies, or other scams.

  2. Each IP address is currently allowed 2 active accounts by default. If you have a redirected old account for a name change it will not count towards your active account limit. If you are in a situation where your IP will be the same as someone else’s, please note that when signing up.

  3. Name changes are restricted to twice a year. If you are requesting a name change, please put in the account creation reason field that you are requesting a name change and what your current account name is.

  4. This is not a server for posting AI-generated content or for creating a bot account, there are many other, better servers to host your bot or if you are interested in AI-generated content.

  5. Content warning is not a general requirement aside from gore, graphic violence, and sexualized nudity. These topics are not allowed on the public timelines (server or federated) without being marked as sensitive and/or a content warning. Posts may be removed if found in violation, and repeatedly violating this rule may result in an account limitation or suspension.

  6. If you're on here you're representing our server in the broader fediverse, so be mindful of your interactions with people off the server as well. Users that are reported for spamming, trolling, or otherwise breaking the rules on this server by other servers in any way may face account suspension or ban.

Moderation Team

@aasyla @Elsanperi @Mewsly @seven @void

Guides

Mastodon

For the moment we recommend you take a look at fedi.tips for some useful guides on how to use Mastodon in general.

Hometown

Hometown has some additional features that we will add additional guides for in the future:

  • Local-only posting
  • Opting out of a public-post RSS feed

Credits

None yet, but we'll add credit for resources used here in the future.

Privacy & Security

While we are not looking to grow this instance, we are working toward following the Mastodon Covenant

  • We are implementing moderation policies against racism, sexism, homophobia, and transphobia.
  • We have daily backups of user data in place.
  • Currently only one user has access to the server infrastructure but we will be working on training others to serve in emergencies.
  • We are committed to 3 months advanced warning in the case the server is being shut down to allow people time to export data and migrate to a new server.

Privacy Policy

DMCA

Illusory Ink respects the intellectual property rights of others. Per the DMCA, we will respond expeditiously to claims of copyright infringement on the Site if submitted to our Copyright Agent as described below. Upon receipt of a notice alleging copyright infringement, We will take whatever action it deems appropriate within its sole discretion, including removal of the allegedly infringing materials and termination of access for repeat infringers of copyright protected content.

If you believe that your intellectual property rights have been violated by us or by a third party who has uploaded materials to our website, please provide the following information to the designated Copyright Agent listed below:

  • A description of the copyrighted work or other intellectual property that you claim has been infringed;
  • A description of where the material that you claim is infringing is located on the Site;
  • An address, telephone number, and email address where we can contact you and, if different, an email address where the alleged infringing party, if not we, can contact you;
  • A statement that you have a good-faith belief that the use is not authorized by the copyright owner or other intellectual property rights owner, by its agent, or by law;
  • A statement by you under penalty of perjury that the information in your notice is accurate and that you are the copyright or intellectual property owner or are authorized to act on the owner's behalf;
  • Your electronic or physical signature.

Illusory Ink may request additional information before removing any allegedly infringing material. In the event we remove the allegedly infringing materials, we will immediately notify the person responsible for posting such materials that we removed or disabled access to the materials. We may also provide the responsible person with your email address so that the person may respond to your allegations.

Pursuant to 17 U.S.C. 512(c). Illusory Ink's designated Copyright Agent is:

Jonathan Bailey
CopyByte
3157 Gentilly Blvd Suite # 2254
New Orleans, LA 70122
Phone: 1-504-356-4555
Email: illusoryink-dmca@copybyte.com

Description:
Goonj is an open, privacy conscious social network. Anyone can join and use it to connect with friends and family.

Open

Goonj is open for everyone to join, but hate speech of any kind is prohibited. Goonj can be joined through any device through our web application. Goonj is open source and based on the popular Mastodon social network.

Privacy Conscious

Users can seamlessly download their entire account data and delete their accounts any time they want. No private information like Real Name, Date of Birth etc. is required to join Goonj. Goonj provides easy control to share your content with a limited audience or to a wider audience as required.

Code of Conduct

Try to be a good neighbour to everyone in the community. Please avoid all behaviour which can be considered spamming, scamming, ponography, NSFW content, advocacy of violence, ethnic/racial/homophobic slurs, harassment, or any other content/activity deemed against the law. Offending content will need to be removed by the user, and repeat offenders will be banned from the community.

We strive to be "work-friendly", so if you post anything that's allowable under our policy but may reasonably be considered objectionable, please use a CW (content warning) to tag it as such.

Moderation activities will be as transparent as possible, with rationales for each action. The community will have the opportunity to review and give input on actions, and the moderation team will be responsive to that.

* Nudity exceptions - the following are okay: Nudity in photos of paintings and sculptures; Breastfeeding (with content warning); Nudity in photos of political expression or significance (with content warning). Examples that don't qualify as exceptions: Nudity in digital art; Nudity with political text simply added to it; etc.


FAQ

How to invite people to follow you

Go to Invites. Check Invite to follow your account, and generate a link. People who sign up through the invite will automatically follow you!

How to enable/disable email notifications

Go to Notifications

Recommended: Enable all notifications to start with; then, if there are any you find you don't like, disable them.

How to export all your data

Go to Data export
Short: Goonj is an open, privacy conscious social network.
A server managed and hosted by Oursky.com for employees, alumni and friends.

Description:
There is a private Mastodon instance setup for the who's who in the web world. Most of us are not cool enough to be invited to that server. I thought it would be nice to have a server where all web designers and developers could join and network. If you are build websites as a freelancer, indie web apps or a developer for a company, this is a great place for you.

Funding

Running this server costs time and money. All donations are welcome and will be put back into making this server better for all of us.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

We usually handle reports within 72 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.
Short: Calling all Web Designers and Developers. This is a Mastodon instance for us all to connect and chat about the amazing websites and web apps we are building.

Description:
KONO는 누구나 사용하실 수 있는 자유 주제 인스턴스입니다. 서로에게 다정한 인스턴스를 지향하고 있어요.

'KONO'라는 이름은 영화 로드오브워의 한 장면에 나오는 배 이름입니다. 이 배는 원래 'KRISTOL'이었지만 경찰에 체포되지 않기 위해 순식간에 새 이름으로 바꿨습니다. 이 유튜브 영상을 보고 하루하루 다급하게 대충 일하며 살아가는 자신의 이야기 같다고 생각하셨다면 잘 오셨습니다.

이 마스토돈 서버의 정보는 docs.kono.pub을 참고하세요.
Short: KONO는 누구나 사용하실 수 있는 자유 주제 인스턴스입니다. 서로에게 다정하게 대하는 서버를 지향하고 있어요. 'KONO'는 영화 로드오브워에 나오는 원래 이름을 방금 'KONO'라는 새 이름으로 바꾼 배 이름인데요, 이름에 대한 자세한 소개는 https://docs.kono.pub 을 참고해 주세요.

Description:
U Fail The World

Welcome to U.Fail, as you can see we are hosting a Mastodon instance on this awesomely short domain with the latest Glitch-soc source code.

Features

Since we run the latest version of Glitch-soc there are some modifications to some default Mastodon values.

  • 2000 max post character limit
  • 4000 ma bio character limit
  • 60 max display name characters
  • Max 6 pinned posts
  • Max 10 poll options
  • HTML / Markdown / Plain post types
  • Local-only posts
  • Extra UI settings panel

Tor access

We also offer a way to access u.fail via the Tor network with our own .onion URL address.

You can access u.fail on Tor via http://5ygtt3534pdtnau6uvoec6hoevtluukew5y3sd2bqrvdkupaewx553yd.onion/about

Instance statistics

More info about the instance statistics can be found one:

  • FediDB

Support the community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little.

You can help out the community by donating in several ways:

  • Become a Patron
  • Support via PayPal
  • Europe Credit Card / iDEAL
  • Support on LiberaPay
  • Buy us a Ko-Fi
  • OpenCollective Backers

European Bank Deposit / IBAN

Stuxhost
NL53 BUNQ 2061 1682 13
BUNQ NL2A XXX

Staff

The full list of staff include:

  • @smux

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Mastodon on U.FAIL
Short: Mastodon instance on this awesomely short domain with the latest Glitch-soc source code.

Description:
Instance

This community is a safe space for anyone interested in IT, software development, cloud-native, DevOps practices, and open-source principles, built around the Italian podcast Continuous Delivery. Here, you can connect with other listeners, share your thoughts and insights, and join the conversation surrounding the latest developments in the software industry.

Whether you're a seasoned practitioner or just getting started in the field, this instance is the perfect place to connect with others, learn from the experts, and stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices in software delivery.

Support

Our Mastodon instance is powered by SparkFabrik, a leading technology company with a focus on cloud native and DevOps practices. With years of expertise in the field, SparkFabrik is committed to supporting and promoting the "Continuous Delivery" podcast and its mission to educate and inform the software development community.

Note

Please note that SparkFabrik does not take responsibility for the content published by users on this Mastodon instance. Users are solely responsible for the accuracy, legality, and reliability of the information they share on this platform. SparkFabrik does not endorse or guarantee the accuracy of any user-generated content and will not be held liable for any damages or losses resulting from the use of information shared by users on this Mastodon instance.
Short: A Mastodon instance built around the Continuous Delivery podcast and supported by SparkFabrik.

Description:
このサーバーについて

ばーちゃるえるふ村は、Twitterからの移住を目的として管理者が作ったインスタンスです。
登録はいつでも大歓迎です。特にテーマはないので、法と倫理に則って好きに使ってください。

サポートについて

完全に個人で管理、維持しているのでサポート対応については期待しないでください。問い合わせがあればできる範囲で努力はします。

費用等

維持費については、すべて管理者が負担します。別途利用料を徴収したり、寄付やクラウドファンディング等で調達することはいたしません。

リレーサーバーについて

ばーちゃるえるふ村は、雪餅様の提供するYUKIMOCHI Toot Relay Serviceに接続しています。
Short:
ばーちゃるえるふ村は、インターネットに存在するばーちゃるでえるふなMastodonインスタンスだよ
人間もえるふも関係なく、好きなことを好きなように好きなだけ話していってください

Description:
Welcome to the OVAL community of professionals in Arts and Sciences.

The goal of this server is to provide a platform for independent established professionals with wide range of experience and expertise in their chosen fields. The OVAL is dedicated to promoting high standards of ethical practice in the profession, connoisseurship and advanced education, and raising public awareness of the paramount role that high quality Art and Science plays in our lives.

We are united by our standards of professionalism, and uphold these standards in our professional practice and as guiding principles of free speech on this server.

STOAT.ZONE is a private server for a small group of existing collaborators with prior agreements about what and how to post, our responsibilities to each other, &c. By sharing the costs of running our own server, we are creating a small, collective online resource for ourselves.

We really recommend this model of participation in the Mastodon ecosystem. Our server is hosted at Masto.host, which is fully managed and couldn't be easier. If large servers aren't for you, try starting one!
Short: The hottest lineage.

Description:
Welcome to MOULE WORLD - A worldbuilding project soundtracking a chaotic world and the cartoon animal characters in it with multi-genre electronic music! Hold on for dear life and Enjoy the Ride!

Now on the Fediverse thanks to Mastodon, you can interact with us from the server(s) you're signed up on! If you're completely new to Mastodon and/or the Fediverse, I highly recommend reading fedi.tips to get started!

This server is hosted on mastodon.moule.world, but thanks to a domain trick our usernames all end with "@moule.world". When viewing our posts, it's best to open mastodon.moule.world in a separate tab to get the full threads and find even more MOULE WORLD posts not federated to your instance!

History of MOULE and MOULE WORLD

I've been producing multi-genre electronic music and digital art since 2015, and after overcoming self-doubt, only began sharing them online from January 1, 2020, starting out on Bandcamp and Twitter.

I started by releasing generic abstract artwork and simple tunes to Bandcamp, before branching out to other services like Spotify etc, gradually gaining the confidence to share my more unique music and cartoony art style.

In mid-2021, the animal characters from my artworks began getting their own names, personalities, and backstories, and my music began soundtracking a world I now call "MOULE WORLD".

In 2022, during chaotic changes at Twitter, I joined the Fediverse! I started my first account on mas.to, then I bought the domain name "moule.world", and taught myself web-hosting and how to set-up this server while banned from Twitter for posting about Elon Musk's jet.

In 2023, I migrated from mas.to to here, and a few months later made my final Tweet after Twitter rebranded to "X". Seven months later in 2024, I deleted my Twitter account, and host a publicly-available archive of my Tweets here.

This is my new "main" social platform and I'm so happy I can continue sharing my world here on the Fediverse!

For the latest MOULE updates, visit MOULE.WORLD!

Acknowledgement of Countries

I create MOULE WORLD's music, artwork, and operate this server on Whadjuk Nyoongar Boodjar, the lands of the Whadjuk Nyoongar people, in south-western Australia.

In addition, this Mastodon server is hosted on Lenapehoking, the lands of the Lenape people, where Newark and New York City are in the USA.

I pay my respects to all Indigenous cultures past, present, and emerging, and to the lands on which I operate.

Funding

This server is funded out of my own pocket, costing AUD$51.00 a month to host on a DigitalOcean server, and AUD$40.80 a year to renew the moule.world domain name.

If you'd like to help support my server's costs, you can donate via PayPal, buy my music on Bandcamp, or buy my designs on Redbubble!

Code of Conduct

Everything I do in this Mastodon instance and my conduct and that of the many characters in it, are part of my own, self-funded solo project hosted in the cloud, with no sign-ups and thus no terms of service. Instead, I have my own Code of Conduct I'll hold myself accountable to, in line with the Mastodon Server Covenant, outlined in the below Server Rules.

The Code of Conduct will also be used as a basis for choosing whether or not MOULE WORLD will federate with other servers. There's 2,500+ instances blocked – half of them being the usual suspects blocked before even opening my server up to the Fediverse.

If you believe I or other MOULE WORLD characters have broken the below Server Rules or would like to dispute a block, feel free to privately message me on the Fediverse (@MOULE@MOULE.WORLD), report the post, or email me, and I'll get back to you as soon as I can!

Credits

• Eugen Rochko et al. – for making the Mastodon software.

• Roni Laukkarinen – for creating the Mastodon Bird UI, which this server uses with some changes to its colours and logo.

• Łukasz Wójcik – for providing an example code of conduct which helped me write the below Server Rules which I hold myself and all MOULE WORLD characters accountable to.

• The numerous contributors who built all the Ruby gems, NPM dependencies, and all the programming for Mastodon and ActivityPub.

• And of course, a HUGE thank you to everyone who supports my music, art, or otherwise interacts with MOULE WORLD. Thank you so much for visiting, and Enjoy the Ride!

(Last updated: May 28, 2024. Added funding information and added Rules 11 and 12)
Short: Soundtracking the MOULE WORLD and its animal characters with multi-genre electronic music!

Description:
f slurs dot gay is an intentionally small fediverse instance, for f slurs and other fruits.

If you think this might be a place for you, please read the server rules, and apply for an account!

As a note, this may not be the most stable instance, I (@sleep) am running this on my lonesome in my free time. While I will not fully promise to follow the Mastodon Server Covenant, I do promise to provide all users with as much time and support as I can to allow them to move to a new instance should I ever decide it's time to turn it off.

Additionally, while I cannot ensure immediate moderation (the instance is currently only run by me), I will attempt to respond to any reports promptly (but please do give me a couple days).

I also promise to do my best to keep this a bigotry free place, as free from transphobia, racism, homophobia, sexism, and any other forms of bigotry I cannot think of while I'm typing this up.

While I do not currently have a full-scale document for outlining my ethos for running this instance (I would like to write that with the community, should one ever start existing here), Darius Kazemi's Run your own social aligns very closely with my own views on running and building a community. I also think any code of conduct that's ever written for f slurs dot gay will end up being very similar to the woof.group code of conduct.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to @sleep!

The default UI theme is Tangerine UI, with some minor modifications.

Description:
Fediverse Instanz für alle St. Paulianer_innen, Menschen aus St. Pauli und St. Pauli Lovers.

Es gilt die Stadionordnung des Millerntors. Home des Podcast St. Pauli POP - Registrierung istoffen

*** und nu das Kleingedruckte ***

I. Nutzungsumfang des Angebots

Stpauli.social betreibt diese Instanz freibleibend; er behält sich vor, die Verfügbarkeit des Angebots jederzeit teilweise oder ganz einzustellen sowie die Gestattung eines Accounts zu widerrufen.

II. Impressum und Haftungserklärung

Diese Instanz wird herausgegeben von:

Erik Hauth St. Pauli* Nu Jugend und Sport e.V., vertreten durch Stefan Schatz c/o Fanladen St. Pauli Heiligengeistfeld 1A, 20359 Hamburg E-Mail: eh (aet) stpaulinu (pt) de

Haftung für eigene und fremde Inhalte

Gemäß § 7 Abs. 1 TMG ist stpauli.scoial allein für eigene Inhalte seines Accounts nach den allgemeinen Gesetzen verantwortlich. Er ist nach §§ 8 bis 10 TMG nicht verpflichtet, übermittelte oder gespeicherte fremde Informationen zu überwachen oder nach Umständen zu forschen, die auf eine rechtswidrige Tätigkeit hinweisen. Unberührt davon bleiben eventuelle Verpflichtungen zur Entfernung oder Sperrung von Informationen nach den allgemeinen Gesetzen. Bei Bekanntwerden von entsprechenden Rechtsverletzungen behält sich die Betreiberin vor, umgehend entsprechende Schritte gegen diese zu ergreifen. Haftung für Links

Die auf der Mastodon-Instanz von stpauli.social mit ihren Accounts vorhandenen Verlinkungen wurden, soweit sie von stpauli.social erstellt wurden, nach bestem Wissen und unter Beachtung größtmöglicher Sorgfalt erstellt und vermitteln lediglich den Zugang zu "fremden Inhalten". Andere Verlinkungen entziehen sich im Hinblick auf deren Auswahl dem Einflussbereich von stpauli.social.

Grundsätzlich hat stpauli.social auf den Inhalt verlinkter Webseiten keinen Einfluss. Für diese wird daher auch keine Verantwortung übernommen. Für verlinkte Inhalte ist stets der jeweilige Betreiber oder Anbieter der verlinkten Seite verantwortlich.

Sollten Sie der Ansicht sein, dass die verlinkten externen Seiten gegen geltendes Recht verstoßen oder sonst unangemessene Inhalte haben, so teilen Sie uns dies bitte mit.

Urheberrecht

Die auf den Accounts der Instanz von stpauli.social erstellten Inhalte unterliegen dem deutschen Urheberrecht. Die Vervielfältigung, Bearbeitung, Verbreitung und jede Art der Verwertung außerhalb der Grenzen des Urheberrechtes bedürfen in der Regel der schriftlichen Zustimmung der/des jeweiligen Rechteinhaberin/Rechteinhabers. Sollten Sie auf eine Urheberrechtsverletzung aufmerksam werden, wenden Sie sich an den Betreiber des betroffenen Accounts. Bei Bekanntwerden von Rechtsverletzungen behält sich stpauli.social vor auch als Betreiber der Instanz gegen diese vorzugehen.

Regeln

Es gilt mein Hausrecht und erweitert die Stadionordnung des FC St. Pauli. Diese Instanz ist ein Safe Place. Nur der Hauch von -Ismus wird geblockt.
Short:
Fediverse Instanz des Podcast St. Pauli POP - offen für alle St. Paulianer_innen, Menschen aus St. Pauli und St. Pauli Lovers.

Registrierung ist derzeit geöffnet.

Phostodon is an invite-only community for those who can get one. As such, our rules are pretty grounded in what we consider a relaxed "reality" and those people who get invited are pretty in that reality already, so do what you do!

Thanks for being here!

Description:
About the Name

CONNECTOPUS /kuh-nektəpʊs/

When we (Octo and John V) had the idea for Connectopus, the friendly octopus connecting you with your community, back in 2016, the landscape seemed prime for a new social platform. We followed many creatives, performers, photographers, and others who had posts constantly reported while hateful and anti-science stuff was left up. After much thinking and when development stalled the idea was scrapped. Now seeing the need for more support to the distributed platforms, the time seemed right to bring the domain back as a Mastodon instance and turn development efforts towards contributing to the open source ActivityPub based ecosystem. Like a friendly octopoda, riding on the back of a proboscidean, here's our instance!

Moderation Team

Fearless leader: @Octo (she/her)
Tech nerd: @johnvenr (he/him)

You should follow @technuition (not a personal account - used for administrative purposes) to see real-time posts for information regarding the server. Also keep an eye out for announcements that appear at the top of your “Home” timeline under the little trumpet icon.

About the Server and Funding

Thanks to Octo, the server this instance runs on is administered and funded by Technuition, a woman owned small business providing IT, technology, and software development services.

If you are able, head to https://patreon.com/johnvenr to pledge your financial support to keeping the instance running - sadly servers and storage cost money and we don't have unlimited financial resources.

Trustees

Special thanks to our “Trustee” level Patreon supporters: @CAman

About the Instance

This Mastodon instance welcomes members of the LGBTQIA+ community and allies. Hate speech and bullying won’t be tolerated. Just because you're behind a computer screen doesn’t mean that you don’t need to respect other people.

We intend for this instance and its moderation to run smoothly. We may or may not notify you when a report you've made has led to a punitive action. Not all punitive actions will be visible to users. First time offenders may have their offensive content removed, but repeat offenders may experience harsher measures up to and including the removal of access to this instance.

This group will not tolerate racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, Nazis, or hate speech which will be determined at the sole discretion of the moderators. All defamatory, abusive, bigoted, threatening, offensive, or illegal material (particularly things illegal in the US as that is where our server is hosted) is strictly prohibited. If you feel that you are experiencing bullying or harassment of any kind please report it to the moderators - report the post or email the administrator account.

We want our community to be able to discuss topics that may be of interest to others but triggering to some. Consent is important in all matters. Some may choose not to see your material so please label things accordingly. If you feel the topic you want to discuss may harm someone who comes across it, please mark it with a content warning (CW). The “CW” button or shield bubble icon with the “!” inside of it. This feature will hide an image that has sensitive content behind a warning banner that can be clicked on to access the material. Sensitive and triggering content may include but not limited to the following: NSFW (we will get into more detail about this later), images with direct eye contact, abuse, wars, graphic images, and mental or physical disorders. Be respectful that everyone has their own experiences and may be triggered by something that you are not triggered by so ensure that you have the proper labels on material. The bottom line is if someone in good faith asks you to CW your post, then kindly use the three dots and select "Delete and re-draft" but this time post with the proper CW.

Since this server is hosted in the US and as a result of (misogynistic) social expectations here, let’s be safe and put all toplessness regardless of gender presentation behind a CW. Any erotic content must also include a CW. If you’re looking to trade your favorite explicit adult content, this is not the place for that. There are other venues for that type of posting.

Further, NSFW is content that you wouldn’t want your manager to see or things you wouldn’t be caught sending to a minor. Minors may be able to see publicly posted non-CW content, so be mindful that your public posts might make their way in front of younger eyes. Please clearly mark explicit content with a CW.

Be respectful of others. We want this to be a welcoming place for people to share and discuss topics that mean something to them. Please try to discuss in good faith. Bad faith arguments are never beneficial. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users or moderators will not be tolerated. If one user has asked for another user to stop certain actions this can be considered harassment and will be addressed accordingly.

Posting or sharing someone's personal information, private data or demographic information without their permission is strictly prohibited.

Some of us make a living by advertising our products and services; however, we’d like to avoid having the instance devolve into a stream of advertisements or requests for money. We also understand that sometimes people need help and mutual aid requests are going to be necessary. If you are unsure if your post is going against this rule, please reach out to the administrator.

If you wonder why we mention actual Nazis this gives a pretty good idea: https://www.upworthy.com/bartender-explains-why-he-swiftly-kicks-nazis-out-of-his-punk-bar-even-if-theyre-not-bothering-anyone

tldr; Karl Popper in 1945:"Unlimited tolerance must lead to the disappearance of tolerance. If we extend unlimited tolerance even to those who are intolerant, if we are not prepared to defend a tolerant society against the onslaught of the intolerant, then the tolerant will be destroyed, and tolerance with them." Bartender at punk bar: "you have to ignore their (the Nazis) reasonable arguments because their end goal is to be terrible, awful people."

Summary of the Rules

  1. This group will not tolerate racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, Nazis, or hate speech which will be determined at the sole discretion of the moderators.
  2. If you are experiencing hate speech or harassment, please report it to the moderators.
  3. Consent matters. Use content warnings (CW) often and always where required (see details above)
  4. NSFW content is allowed behind CW banners
  5. Be respectful of others
  6. No harassment or stalking
  7. No posting or sharing another user's personal information
  8. No excessive posting of advertisements or requesting for cash (see details above)

Note on Privacy

Posts made public are replicated on servers across the fediverse. Your content may spread further than you expect.

"Direct messages" (which are @ only posts) are not end-to-end encrypted and sit on servers of the users mentioned unencrypted. If you need secure truly private conversations we suggest you DM a means to communicate using a more secure channel outside of the fediverse.

This is the breakdown of known stored information and who can see it:

  • username
    • used to identify you here on the server and with @connectop.us identifies you in the fediverse
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • email address
    • used to send you notifications, restore access to your account, identify you for login
    • moderators and technical admins
  • ip address (public facing ip only)
    • used by the server to prevent flooding attacks, may appear in mastodon logs for up to 2 days, may appear in web server logs for 7 or more days depending on the amount of server traffic
    • accessible to the moderators (for up to 2 days) and technical admins
  • date/time joined
    • used to show on your profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • date/time of last activity
    • used for maintaining sessions, used for server statistics
    • moderators and technical admins
  • interface language
    • used for server statistics
    • moderators and technical admins
  • password
    • used to log you into the system, stored hashed in the mastodon database
    • the hash could be accessed by admins but there is no reason they would do so
  • 2FA status
    • used to log you into the system, status (enabled/disabled) for user administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • number of posts
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration, shown on profile
    • the public, moderators and technical admins
  • size in bytes of media attachements
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • number of followers
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration, shown on profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • number of users following you
    • shown on profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • number of time you made post or user moderation reports
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • number of times other users reported you or your posts for moderation
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • profile text and links
    • used to show on your profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • usernames of followers
    • used to show on your profile, can be hidden in user settings
    • the public (if shown) and technical admins
  • usernames of users you follow
    • used to show on your profile, can be hidden in user settings
    • the public (if shown) and technical admins
  • public posts
    • used to show on your profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • unlisted posts
    • used to show on your profile but excluded from explore/discovery
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • followers only posts
    • used to show to your followers, stored in this server and the servers of your followers
    • your followers, moderators (local and on remote servers), and technical admins(local and remote)
  • mentioned users only posts
    • used to show to the users mentioned, stored in this server and the servers of the users mentioned
    • the users mentioned, moderators (local and on remote servers), and technical admins(local and remote)
Short: This server hopes to build a respectful community, with a diverse group of people: inclusive of the LGBTQIA+ community; and standing up for POC, trans, and other marginalized communities.

Description:
Welcome!

inductive.space is a tiny Mastodon server for me and friendly people who like programming languages, free software, urbanism or just want to hang out.

It's run by me, Eisfunke. This is very much not a professional operation, but rather a hobby project running from my homeserver. I try my best, I do know my way around server stuff, I keep off-site backups et cetera, but still, please adjust your expectations.

Software

inductive.space runs glitch-soc, which is a fork of of Mastodon's development version with some additional features, such as Markdown posting and more. It can potentially be a little less stable than "normal" Mastodon, so bear with us if something breaks (hasn't happened so far). We also have a higher post length limit of 2520 characters.

This instance follow various other instances and hashtags via relay.fedi.buzz fitting to the instance focus topics listed below. This means the federated timeline you'll see here will contain a lot of stuff from these topics.

The instance runs on NixOS and is configured via NixOS. The configuration running on my server is public and FOSS, you can take a look at it on my GitLab.

Please read the rules

If you want to join, please read and follow the rules below. The Berlin Code of Conduct applies here. I'm committed to make this a friendly, cozy and inductive space for all kinds of people.

Is this the instance for me?

It might be! This is a very small and not a professional server mainly geared to my own usage, and you should consider the downsides of that.

Being small also has upsides though, e.g. we can easily keep a low profile and stay out of fediverse drama. Also, our federated feed is curated (see above) to the server focus topics (see below). It's also more personal – ideally, I want this server to feel like a digital living room to have fun in. It's probably not well suited as a professional forum or something like that.

This might be a good instance for you if you're interested in any of the following:

  • programming languages, types, (theoretical) computer science (as you might have guessed from the domain)
  • free software
  • any kind of science or tech in general
  • urban planning, urbanism, bikes, criticism of car-centric design, maps, OpenStreetMap
  • politics, sociology: from digital privacy over capitalism-critical economics and critical theory to feminism
  • books, podcasts
  • travelling, hiking
  • the people already here

This is probably not a good instance for you if you're politcally conservative, libertarian or right-wing, if you strongly dislike any of the above or if you just want to fight with people who like any of the above.

If I think your posts don't fit well into the instance's community and culture I might ask for you to look for an instance that fits you better, even if you don't explicitly break any rules.

If all that stuff hasn't put you off, and you'd like to participate, feel free to send a join request!

Fediblock Policy

I'm keeping up with the tier 0 blocklist from the oliphant.social blocklists. That keeps out the baseline of Nazi instances and similar stuff.

Apart from that, I mostly only block (a.k. suspend or defederate) instances if they cause problems. Part of the luxury of being a small instance with few people with similar interests is that we're only really interacting with a focused slice of fedi anyway. If you need a sturdier blocklist or an instance in a more curated slice of fedi, you're probably better off on another server.

Disclaimer

This instance is still quite new, and I'm new to the business of running a Mastodon instance, so please bear with me. I'm open to feedback, constructive criticism and suggestions regarding the instance and the rules.

However, please remember that this isn't a democracy in the end, rule interpretation and final decisions will be done by me. The great thing about the fediverse is that if you disagree with my decisions, you can always look for an instance you'd be happier on.

Custom Emoji

  • Neocat by Volpeon (license: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)
  • Neofox by Volpeon (license: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)

Imprint

Description:
はじめに

ご利用の前に、以下を御覧ください。 - この Mastodon インスタンスのルール ページ - 以下に続く yude.jp 全体の利用規約

yude が実験的に提供している Mastodon インスタンスです。予告なくサービスが一時的なメンテナンス状態に移行することがあります。

yude.jp サービス利用規約

yude.jp ドメイン以下に設置されているサービスについて、以下の利用規約が適用されます。

サービス運用について

yude が実験的に運用しており、完全に無保証で提供されるものです。 事前の予告なくサーバーのメンテナンスを行う場合など、予告なくサービスの提供が一時停止、または永久に停止されることがあります。

禁止行為

以下の行為を、yude.jp で提供されるサービスにおいて行うことを禁止します。 違反が見受けられた場合、管理者またはモデレーターによってアカウントに対し何らかの処分が下される可能性があります。

  • 成人向け、またはグロテスクな画像・動画の投稿
  • 常識を逸脱した暴言
  • スパム行為
  • サーバーへのクラック行為
  • 管理者が不適切であると判断した行為 その他、サーバーの設置拠点である日本国の法律が適用されます。

その他

この利用規約は管理者が利用者に対して了承を得ず更新することができますが、その際には必ず通知を Mastodon インスタンス内、または Twitter 上 (@yudejp または @yude_jp) において行うものとします。

サーバー構成

  • Mastodon インスタンス本体: オンプレミス (日本, 鳥取県)
  • メディア: Cloudflare R2
Short: @yude@mstdn.soine.site が実験的に提供している Mastodon インスタンスです。予告なくサービスがメンテナンス状態に移行することがあります。

Description: This server is ran by a writer, a plural system, an LGBTQ community member, and a woman. Hi, I'm Lauren, and I have a passion for writing, so I thought I'd run my own server. It is hosted by masto.host and was set up by a good friend of mine who runs the tweesecake server.
Short: At night, the moonbow brings out the creative in you. Plurals, witches, Writers, LGBTQ+, and good people welcomed!

Description:
What is SolarSystem.social?

solarsystem.social is a Mastodon server for the planetary science community.

Who can join?

Any professional working in the field of planetary science can join, including:

  • students, postdocs, researchers, professors, engineers, and administrators,

  • institutions, societies, communities, academic journals and publishers,

  • journalists, science educators, science promoters, and the occassional well-behaved bot.

When creating an account, please let the moderator know who you are and how you fit the above criteria. If we can not verify that you are an active planetary scientist, your account will not be approved. If this server is not for you, please consider joining one of the other great communities on Mastodon, such as those listed on Academics on Mastodon.

What can you talk about?

You can post on any subject that interests you, personal or professional, including (but not limited to) planetary science!

How can I find accounts to follow?

First, check out the opt-in list of planetary science accounts on Mastodon.

Second, you can use Followgraph for Mastodon. This returns a list of accounts that are followed by the people you follow.

How is this server funded?

The administrators of this site pay for both the domain name and the hosting at masto.host. The base operating cost for a small instance of a hundred users is about two hundred dollars per year, but as the number of accounts grows, so will the cost of maintaining it. If this mastodon instance is to serve the entire planetary science community, it will require donations from its members.

How to donate?

There is no requirement to donate to create an account, but if you would like to see this community thrive, please consider setting up an appropriate donation. Break even costs for running this server would be about 1-2 dollars per year if every user contributed. We accept several types of donations:

  • Liberapay.com (recurring donations)
  • ko-fi (one-time or recurring donations)
  • PayPal (one-time donation)
  • crypto, bank transfers, other (contact admin)

All donations will be used exclusively for maintaining solarsystem.social activities. Excess funds will either be used to fund future operations or to develop additional services (such as a peertube instance, a pixelfed instance, or a matrix server, for example).

Privacy statement

We will never provide or sell any information about any of our users to any party. We do not require you to use your real name, and we encourage you to use single-use email addresses. Nevertheless, please be aware that all your posts are public, and that private messages are not end-to-end encrypted. You should expect that anything you post here will eventually be consumed by data scrapers and search engines. We host this server using masto.host, but even though they also respect your privacy, data breaches can occur. If you need to communicate with someone privately, please use an end-to-end encrypted messenger.
Short: A Mastodon server for the planetary science community.

Description:
Small public server hosted on a home system, leftist lgbtqia admin. No tolerance for intolerance.

Open registration (check your spam for registration emails), wide array of addons enabled (if you want one I haven't enabled, just let me know).

Open to small businesses, but advertisement posts must be tagged # advertisement and must otherwise follow good decorum.

Got questions? Hit me up at shiri[at]foggyminds.com or on Matrix at @shiri:beeper.com
